alert.note: Alert for Greater Vancouver Area; Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County; South Washington Cascade Foothills (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 12:22PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Columbia, northwestern Clark and south central Cowlitz Counties through 1245 PM PDT... At 1221 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rainier, or 7 miles southwest of Kelso, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kelso, Woodland, Kalama, Columbia City, Rainier, Prescott, Carrolls, Goble, Rose Valley and Apiary. This includes the following highways in Washington... Interstate 5 between mile markers 21 and 36. State Route 503 near mile marker 54. In Oregon this includes U.S. Highway 30 west of Portland between mile markers 32 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Greater Vancouver Area; Lower Columbia and I - 5 Corridor in Cowlitz County; South Washington Cascade Foothills
